sentences.english: Since his parents died of illness, he has been homeless.
sentences.chinese: 自從他的父母病故以來，他就一直無家可歸。

sentences.english: He received a telegram saying that his mother had died.
sentences.chinese: 他收到一份電報，說他的母親已病故。

sentences.english: When my father died, I forgot about the dress.
sentences.chinese: 父親病故後，我把那件衣服給忘了。

sentences.english: Two weeks after this photograph was taken, he passed away.
sentences.chinese: 在照片拍攝兩週後，他病故了。

sentences.english: Two years ago, one of my close relatives died from stomach cancer.
sentences.chinese: 兩年前，我的一位近親因胃癌病故。

sentences.english: On Sunday, she died after a long illness and Biden campaign events for Monday and Tuesday were also canceled.
sentences.chinese: 她週日病故，拜登週一和週二的競選活動也宣告取消。

sentences.english: Xiao Hong was full of setbacks and frustrations in her life, suffering from all kinds of tribulation. She died in Hong Kong for illness only at 31 years old.
sentences.chinese: 蕭紅一生命途多舛，受盡磨難，31歲就在香港病故。

definition: to leave one's mortal frame (idiom)/to die
to die/to depart this life (euphemism)/same as 去世
to fall gravely ill, never to recover (idiom)
to fall ill and die/to die of illness
sudden attack of a serious illness
